poem:
**Backflip**

In the theatre of pretense,
a backflip arcs through air,
a masterstroke on false threads—
deceit's delicate ballet.

Demi's smile, a polished mask,
mirth unfurls in disguise. 
We laugh, fooled and delighted,
weightless in the lie.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Demi Adejuyigbe Is Going to Do One (1) Backflip review – joyous and ingenious Not all comedy shows need weighty themes or moments of bare-all vulnerability just before curtain-fall. Demi Adejuyigbe pretends to have the latter, but I wasn’t fooled. Which made a change: this American act (also a writer on US sitcom The Good Place) is a master of the rug-pull, constructing one usually daft reality only to subvert it before you’ve found your". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
